p:
Respiratory tract infections are diagnosed as the underlying cause of febrile illness in 7% to 24% of returning travelers.
4 These include sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis, bronchitis, influenza, pneumonia, and pulmonary eosinophilia. Influenza is the most common vaccine-preventable infection acquired by travelers. The following are clinical and epidemiologic associations (see disease-specific chapters for details).
